Introduction

Base URL: http://127.0.0.1:8000

This documentation aims to provide all the information you need to work with our API.

As you scroll, you'll see code examples for working with the API in different programming languages in the dark area to the right (or as part of the content on mobile). You can switch the language used with the tabs at the top right (or from the nav menu at the top left on mobile).

Authenticating requests

This API is not authenticated.

Authentication

List of Ecclesia

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/register-ecclesi-list" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/register-ecclesi-list"
);

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "eclessias": [
        {
            "id": 4,
            "name": "JMK",
            "country": "2",
            "created_at": "2024-08-02T22:44:52.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-08-05T15:10:55.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 3,
            "name": "JMK Shelby",
            "country": "5",
            "created_at": "2024-08-02T11:04:31.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-08-05T15:11:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 2,
            "name": "Pastor Dr. Paul Devakumar",
            "country": "14",
            "created_at": "2024-07-26T23:53:53.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-08-05T15:11:04.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "Pastor German Ace",
            "country": "17",
            "created_at": "2024-07-26T23:53:42.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-08-05T15:11:08.000000Z"
        }
    ]
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "No Ecclesia records found."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/register-ecclesi-list

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Lists Country

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/register-country-list" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/register-country-list"
);

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
  "countries": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "name": "Country Name",
      "created_at": "2024-11-11T00:00:00.000000Z",
      "updated_at": "2024-11-11T00:00:00.000000Z"
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "name": "Country Name 2",
      "created_at": "2024-11-11T00:00:00.000000Z",
      "updated_at": "2024-11-11T00:00:00.000000Z"
    },
    ...
  ]
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "No records found."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/register-country-list

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

States by country

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/register-states-list" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"country\": 1
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/register-states-list"
);

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "country": 1
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
  "states": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "name": "State Name",
      "country_id": 1,
      "created_at": "2024-11-12T00:00:00.000000Z",
      "updated_at": "2024-11-12T00:00:00.000000Z"
    },
    ...
  ]
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "No states found for the specified country."
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while fetching states."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/register-states-list

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

country   integer   

The ID of the country to fetch states for. Example: 1

Register a new user

Registers a new user and sends an email for account pending approval.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/register" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"user_name\": \"johndoe\",
    \"email\": \"johndoe@example.com\",
    \"ecclesia_id\": 4,
    \"first_name\": \"John\",
    \"last_name\": \"Doe\",
    \"middle_name\": \"A.\",
    \"address\": \"123 Main St\",
    \"phone\": \"1234567890\",
    \"city\": \"Springfield\",
    \"state\": 14,
    \"address2\": \"Apt 4B\",
    \"country\": 5,
    \"zip\": \"62704\",
    \"email_confirmation\": \"johndoe@example.com\",
    \"password\": \"Password@123\",
    \"password_confirmation\": \"Password@123\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/register"
);

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "user_name": "johndoe",
    "email": "johndoe@example.com",
    "ecclesia_id": 4,
    "first_name": "John",
    "last_name": "Doe",
    "middle_name": "A.",
    "address": "123 Main St",
    "phone": "1234567890",
    "city": "Springfield",
    "state": 14,
    "address2": "Apt 4B",
    "country": 5,
    "zip": "62704",
    "email_confirmation": "johndoe@example.com",
    "password": "Password@123",
    "password_confirmation": "Password@123"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Please wait for admin approval",
    "user": {
        "id": 1,
        "user_name": "johndoe",
        "email": "johndoe@example.com",
        "first_name": "John",
        "last_name": "Doe",
        "created_at": "2024-11-06T10:00:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-06T10:00:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (409):


{
    "error": "Phone number already exists"
}

Example response (422):


{
    "errors": {
        "email": [
            "The email has already been taken."
        ]
    }
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/register

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

user_name   string   

Unique username for the user. Example: johndoe

email   string   

Unique email address. Example: johndoe@example.com

ecclesia_id   integer  optional  

nullable Ecclesia ID if applicable. Example: 4

first_name   string   

First name of the user. Example: John

last_name   string   

Last name of the user. Example: Doe

middle_name   string  optional  

nullable Middle name of the user. Example: A.

address   string   

Address of the user. Example: 123 Main St

phone   string   

User's phone number. Example: 1234567890

city   string   

City of residence. Example: Springfield

state   integer   

State of residence. Example: 14

address2   string  optional  

nullable Additional address information. Example: Apt 4B

country   integer   

Country of residence. Example: 5

zip   string   

Zip code. Example: 62704

email_confirmation   string   

Confirmation of the email address. Must match email. Example: johndoe@example.com

password   string   

Password for the user. Must be at least 8 characters and include one special character (@$%&). Example: Password@123

password_confirmation   string   

Confirmation of the password. Must match password. Example: Password@123

Login

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/login" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"user_name\": \"john_doe\",
    \"password\": \"password\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/login"
);

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "user_name": "john_doe",
    "password": "password"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
"token": "dsdsdsd"
"status": true
"message": "Login successful"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/login

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

user_name   string   

The username or email of the user. Example: john_doe

password   string   

The password of the user. Example: password

Register Agreement Details

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/register-agreement" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/register-agreement"
);

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
"status": true
"message": "Data found"
 "data": {
   "id": 1,
   "agreement_title": "LION ROARING PMA (PRIVATE MEMBERS ASSOCIATION) AGREEMENT",
   "agreement_description": "<p>It is the responsibility of the members to read and review the Articles of Association of Lion Roaring PMA in its entirety and agree to adopt and comply to its belief, foundation and purpose of the Lion Roaring PMA. <a href=\"http://127.0.0.1:8001/login\"><strong>Click here to read the full document XXXXXXXX</strong></a></p><h4><strong>Each member agrees to the following excerpt taken from the Articles of Association of PMA:</strong></h4><ul><li>1. Lion Roaring PMA is a Private Members Association protected under the Constitution of the United States of America and the original constitution for these united States of America and the Maryland Constitution</li><li>2. Member agrees and is supportive to the mission and vision of the Lion Roaring</li><li>3. Member strives to contribute to the purpose of the PMA to fulfill the God given call to the founding members as it is written in Section 4 through 15 in the Article of Association</li><li>4. Member will not hold Lion Roaring PMA liable for any materials or contents posted in the website or any paperwork, written articles, education materials or others created within the PMA for its members’ benefits and private usage</li><li>5. Member’s agreement does not entitle a member to any financial or other interest in the Private Members Association or management thereof</li><li>6. Information regarding details of the association, any materials produced or created by Lion Roaring PMA including all paperwork, agreements, articles, PowerPoints presentations, word parchments, coaching, and education materials are private intellectual property of the PMA and will not be shared, replicated, dispersed or distributed with anyone outside the PMA without explicit written permission from the founder</li><li>7. Member’s due diligence is expected and member will hold harmless any member or founder of Lion Roaring PMA and any dispute shall be handled by the founder(s) with final decision for remedy made by the founder(s) and shall be accepted as a settled matter. (Article III for disputes resolution &amp; Article IV for Sovereignty in the Private)</li><li>8. As a private member of the Lion Roaring PMA, member is invoking its united States constitutional rights specifically the 1st, 4th, 5th, 9th and 10th and the Maryland Constitutional rights included in the Maryland Declaration of Rights Sections 1, 2, 6, 10, 24, 26, 36, 40 and 45 and as such take full responsibility for his or her behavior, such that his or her actions shall never constitute anything that can be determined to be of a “clear and present danger of a substantial evil.”</li><li>9. Any actions by the member which are not consistent with the values of the PMA can result in the founder’s decision to ask the member to leave the PMA</li><li>10. Member is connected with each other and the actions affect one another, therefore, the Lion Roaring PMA encourages and supports one another as a family and community</li><li>11. Member and those who are included in this member’s agreement and contract are solely responsible for member’s own outcome or results from participating or receiving any education materials, counsel, coaching, training, mentoring or other services provided by Lion Roaring PMA through its websites or any other resources made available to the members</li><li>12. The terminology used in these articles of organization and member’s agreement is used solely for clarification of the various usages for Private Members Association under universal contract law by and between free, spiritually free men and women, creations of nature and Natures God, whose lives and rights derive from God Almighty and unique Covenant of the man and/or woman with the Creator</li><li>13. Any reference within the Articles of Association to the man shall also include the woman and any reference to one people may include many people. This PMA shall be construed and interpreted in the private and all decisions or disputes will be final as settled by the founders in accordance with Article III</li><li>14. Member agrees that the elimination of one Item or segment of this Agreement does not eliminate the entirety of the Agreement but the Agreement will remain as Agreed</li></ul><p><br>&nbsp;</p>",
   "created_at": "2024-04-18T08:40:32.000000Z",
   "updated_at": "2024-04-18T08:40:32.000000Z"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/register-agreement

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Bulletins

Bulletins List

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/bulletins/load?search=%22abc%22" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/bulletins/load"
);

const params = {
    "search": ""abc"",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "user_id": 1,
            "title": "Sample Bulletin Title",
            "description": "Sample Bulletin Description",
            "created_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z"
        }
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/v3/user/bulletins/load

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

search   string  optional  

optional for search. Example: "abc"

Fetch Single Bulletin

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/bulletins/view/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/bulletins/view/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "user_id": 2,
        "title": "Sample Bulletin Title",
        "description": "Sample bulletin description",
        "created_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (201):


{
    "error": "Bulletin not found."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/v3/user/bulletins/view/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the bulletin to retrieve. Example: 1

Bulletin Board

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/bulletins/board?search=%22abc%22" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/bulletins/board"
);

const params = {
    "search": ""abc"",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "user_id": 2,
            "title": "Sample Bulletin Title",
            "description": "Sample bulletin description",
            "created_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
            "user": {
                "id": 12,
                "ecclesia_id": 2,
                "created_id": "1",
                "user_name": "swarnadwip_nath",
                "first_name": "Swarnadwip",
                "middle_name": null,
                "last_name": "Nath",
                "email": "swarnadwip@excellisit.net",
                "phone": "+1 0741202022",
                "email_verified_at": null,
                "profile_picture": "profile_picture/yCvplMhdpjc0kIeKG63tfkZwhKNYbcF1ZhfQdDFO.jpg",
                "address": "Kokata",
                "city": "Kolkata",
                "state": "41",
                "address2": null,
                "country": "101",
                "zip": "700001",
                "status": 1,
                "created_at": "2024-06-21T11:31:27.000000Z",
                "updated_at": "2024-09-09T11:02:59.000000Z"
            }
        },
        {
            "id": 2,
            "user_id": 3,
            "title": "Another Bulletin Title",
            "description": "Another bulletin description",
            "created_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
            "user": {
                "id": 13,
                "ecclesia_id": 2,
                "created_id": "1",
                "user_name": "john_doe",
                "first_name": "John",
                "middle_name": null,
                "last_name": "Chiera",
                "email": "john@yopmail.com",
                "phone": "07412020202",
                "email_verified_at": null,
                "profile_picture": "profile_picture/lX7sKGrvLYx22gM1qwGKXToQbPI4ILBFQHxThou7.jpg",

                "city": "Kolkata",
                "state": "West Bengal",
                "address2": null,

            }
        }
    ]
}

{
    "error": "Failed to load bulletins."
}

Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/v3/user/bulletins/board

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

search   string  optional  

optional for search. Example: "abc"

Create Bulletin

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/bulletins/store" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"title\": \"\\\"New Bulletin Title\\\"\",
    \"description\": \"\\\"Details about the bulletin.\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/bulletins/store"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "title": "\"New Bulletin Title\"",
    "description": "\"Details about the bulletin.\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Bulletin created successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "user_id": 1,
        "title": "New Bulletin Title",
        "description": "Details about the bulletin.",
        "created_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (201):


{
    "error": "Failed to create bulletin."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/bulletins/store

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

title   string   

The title of the bulletin. Example: "New Bulletin Title"

description   string   

The description of the bulletin. Example: "Details about the bulletin."

Update Bulletin

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request PUT \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/bulletins/edit/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"title\": \"\\\"Updated Bulletin Title\\\"\",
    \"description\": \"\\\"Updated details about the bulletin.\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/bulletins/edit/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "title": "\"Updated Bulletin Title\"",
    "description": "\"Updated details about the bulletin.\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "PUT",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Bulletin updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "user_id": 1,
        "title": "Updated Bulletin Title",
        "description": "Updated details about the bulletin.",
        "created_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (201):


{
    "error": "Bulletin not found or unauthorized."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

PUT api/v3/user/bulletins/edit/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the bulletin to update. Example: 1

Body Parameters

title   string  optional  

The new title of the bulletin. Example: "Updated Bulletin Title"

description   string  optional  

The new description of the bulletin. Example: "Updated details about the bulletin."

Remove Bulletin

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/bulletins/delete/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/bulletins/delete/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Bulletin deleted successfully."
}

Example response (201):


{
    "error": "Bulletin not found or unauthorized."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

id   integer

    --header "Accept: application/json"

    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/cms/gallery"
);

    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/cms/common"
);

    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Get Our Governance

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/cms/our-governance" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"slug\": \"robert-hyde\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/cms/our-governance"
);

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "slug": "robert-hyde"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Without the relationships in place, no teaching will be effective. He also learned the value of cooperative learning and “hands on” or learning by doing, while striving to make learning fun as key components for student engagement and learning. Bob used these strategies as his focus in his teaching and programs like Peer Tutoring, Homework Club, and the National Junior Honor Society that he led throughout his career.\r\nPrior to working in the education field, Bob spent over 20 years in the business world working as a team manager in the insurance industry. Responsibilities included overseeing high dollar claims settlements, personnel management, and customer service. One key takeaway from this profession was the ability to successfully communicate with various stakeholders (superiors, peers, subordinates, customers). Learning skills like compassion and simply listening to others’ needs and desires went a long way to him being able to establish rapport and successful working relationships with all stakeholders.\r\nBob retired from teaching in 2022 and has since concentrated on learning America’s “true history,” his rightful status as a united States citizen, loving on and assisting family members through trying circumstances, and by learning and relying on God to become more intimate with his Creator. Our organization center

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/cms/organization-center" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"slug\": \"lion-roaring-innovation-center, lion-roaring-education-center-1709707179.\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/cms/organization-center"
);

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "slug": "lion-roaring-innovation-center, lion-roaring-education-center-1709707179."
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Member Privacy Policy

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/cms/members-privacy-policy" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/cms/members-privacy-policy"
);

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Privacy Policy",
    "status": true,
    "privacy_policy": {
        "id": 1,
        "description": "<p><strong>Privacy Policy for Member Accounts on My Lion Roaring Website</strong></p><p>At My Lion Roaring, we are committed to protecting the privacy and security of our members' personal information. This Privacy Policy outlines how we collect, use, disclose, and protect your information when you create and use an account on our website. By becoming a member, you agree to the terms outlined in this policy.</p><p><strong>Information We Collect:</strong></p><p><strong>Account Information:</strong> When you create an account, we collect your name, email address, username, password, and any other information you choose to provide, such as profile pictures or biographical details.</p><p><strong>Usage Data:</strong> We automatically collect information about how you interact with our website, including your IP address, browser type, device information, pages visited, and timestamps of your visits.</p><p><strong>Communication Data:</strong> If you contact us through our website or via email, we may keep a record of that communication, including the content and metadata.</p><p><strong>How We Use Your Information:</strong></p><p><strong>Account Management:</strong> We use your account information to manage your membership, provide access to our services, and personalize your experience on our website.</p><p><strong>Communication:</strong> We may use your contact information to send you important updates, newsletters, promotional offers, and other communications related to our services. You can opt out of these communications at any time.</p><p><strong>Analytics and Improvements:</strong> We analyze usage data to improve our website, enhance user experience, and optimize our services.</p><p><strong>Information Sharing and Disclosure:</strong></p><p><strong>Service Providers:</strong> We may share your information with third-party service providers who assist us in operating our website, conducting business, or providing services to you. These providers are contractually obligated to protect your information and use it only for authorized purposes.</p><p><strong>Legal Compliance:</strong> We may disclose your information if required to do so by law, regulation, or legal process, or if we believe that disclosure is necessary to protect our rights, property, or safety, or the rights, property, or safety of others.</p><p><strong>Data Security:</strong></p><p>We take appropriate measures to protect your information from unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. However, please note that no method of transmission over the internet or electronic storage is 100% secure, and we cannot guarantee absolute security.</p><p><strong>Your Choices and Rights:</strong></p><p><strong>Access and Update:</strong> You can access and update your account information at any time by logging into your account settings.</p><p><strong>Data Removal:</strong> You can request the deletion of your account and associated information by contacting us. However, please note that some information may be retained as necessary for legal or legitimate business purposes.</p><p><strong>Marketing Preferences:</strong> You can manage your communication preferences and opt out of marketing communications through your account settings or by contacting us.</p><p><strong>Changes to This Policy:</strong></p><p>We reserve the right to update or modify this Privacy Policy at any time. We will notify you of any significant changes by posting the updated policy on our website or by other means of communication.</p><p><strong>Contact Us:</strong></p><p>If you have any questions, concerns, or requests regarding your privacy or this Privacy Policy, please contact us at <a href=\"http://127.0.0.1:8000/contact-us\">Click</a>.</p><p><br>&nbsp;</p>",

        "updated_at": "2024-04-25T05:27:23.000000Z"
    }

Chats

List of Chat Users

requires authentication

Retrieves a list of users with whom the authenticated user has chatted, sorted by the most recent message.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/chats/list" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/chats/list"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Request      

POST api/v3/user/chats/list

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Chats with a specific user

requires authentication

Retrieves the chat history between the authenticated user and a specified recipient, marking unseen messages as seen.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/chats/load" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"sender_receiver_id\": 1
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/chats/load"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "sender_receiver_id": 1
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Show Chat",
    "status": true,

Request      

POST api/v3/user/chats/load

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

sender_receiver_id   integer   

ID of the sender (the another user). Example: 1

Send a chat message

requires authentication

Allows the authenticated user to send a message or attachment to a specified receiver. Returns the latest message and message counts.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/chats/send" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "reciver_id=2"\
    --form "message=Hello there!"\
    --form "file=@/private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpX13KSy" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/chats/send"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('reciver_id', '2');
body.append('message', 'Hello there!');
body.append('file', document.querySelector('input[name="file"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "msg": "Message sent successfully",
    "chat": {
        "id": 564,
        "sender_id": 37,
        "reciver_id": 12,
        "message": "hello testing",
        "deleted_for_sender": 0,
        "deleted_for_reciver": 0,
        "attachment": "chat/wXKPA5V0cft8m66c3nR1QWdHnmxgZWv4NBj07zhL.pdf",
        "seen": 0,
        "created_at": "2024-11-07T07:25:54.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-07T07:25:54.000000Z",
        "delete_from_sender_id": 0,
        "delete_from_receiver_id": 0,
        "created_at_formatted": "2024-11-07 02:25:54",
        "sender": {
            "id": 37,
            "ecclesia_id": 4,
            "created_id": null,
            "user_name": "masum1",
            "first_name": "masum",
            "middle_name": null,
            "last_name": "ali",
            "email": "masum@excellisit.net",
            "phone": "+91 96470 38098",
            "email_verified_at": "2024-10-28T08:35:17.000000Z",
            "profile_picture": "profile_picture/sLWWnksqS6PHYMdZeBQ4OK3SnbVA0oMc9oykPbCn.webp",
            "address": "kolkata",
            "city": "kolkata",
            "state": "41",
            "address2": "kolkata",
            "country": "101",
            "zip": "700001",
            "status": 1,
            "created_at": "2024-10-28T08:35:17.000000Z",

        },
        "reciver": {
            "id": 12,
            "ecclesia_id": 2,
            "created_id": "1",
            "user_name": "swarnadwip_nath",
            "first_name": "Swarnadwip",
            "middle_name": null,
            "last_name": "Nath",
            "email": "swarnadwip@excellisit.net",

            "email_verified_at": null,
            "profile_picture": "profile_picture/yCvplMhdpjc0kIeKG63tfkZwhKNYbcF1ZhfQdDFO.jpg",

            "city": "Kolkata",
            "state": "41",
            "address2": null,
            "country": "101",
            "zip": "700001",
            "status": 1,
            "created_at": "2024-06-21T11:31:27.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-09-09T11:02:59.000000Z"
        }
    },
    "chat_count": 14,
    "success": true
}

Example response (201):


{
    "msg": "An error occurred while sending the message.",
    "success": false
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/chats/send

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

reciver_id   integer   

ID of the receiver (chat partner). Example: 2

message   string  optional  

Optional message text if sending a text message. Example: Hello there!

file   file  optional  

Optional file attachment for the chat message. Example: /private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpX13KSy

Clear Chat Messages

requires authentication

Clears chat messages between the authenticated user and a specified receiver by marking messages as deleted from each side.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/chats/clear" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"reciver_id\": 2
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/chats/clear"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "reciver_id": 2
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "msg": "Chat cleared successfully",
    "success": true
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/chats/clear

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

reciver_id   integer   

The ID of the user to clear chat with. Example: 2

Mark Chat as Seen

requires authentication

Marks a specific chat message as seen by updating its seen status.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/chats/seen" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"chat_id\": 10,
    \"reciver_id\": 2
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/chats/seen"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "chat_id": 10,
    "reciver_id": 2
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "msg": "Chat seen successfully",
    "status": true,
    "last_chat": {
        "id": 10,
        "sender_id": 1,
        "reciver_id": 2,
        "message": "Hello!",
        "seen": 1,
        "created_at": "2024-11-07T14:52:36.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-07T15:05:12.000000Z"
    }
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/chats/seen

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

chat_id   integer   

The ID of the chat message to mark as seen. Example: 10

reciver_id   integer   

The ID of the receiver user. Example: 2

Remove Chat Message

requires authentication

Removes a specific chat message for the authenticated user. The message can be removed for "everyone" or marked as deleted for the sender only.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/chats/remove" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"chat_id\": 10,
    \"del_from\": \"\\\"me\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/chats/remove"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "chat_id": 10,
    "del_from": "\"me\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "msg": "Chat removed successfully",
    "status": true,
    "chat": {
        "id": 10,
        "sender_id": 1,
        "reciver_id": 2,
        "message": "Hello!",
        "created_at": "2024-11-07T14:52:36.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-07T15:05:12.000000Z"
    }
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/chats/remove

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

chat_id   integer   

The ID of the chat message to be removed. Example: 10

del_from   string   

Specifies if the message should be deleted for "everyone" or only for the sender ("me"). Example: "me"

Manage Chat Notifications

requires authentication

Sends a notification to the receiver when they receive a new chat message. If is_delete is set, it marks the specified notification as deleted.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/chats/notification" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"chat_id\": 15,
    \"user_id\": 5,
    \"is_delete\": 1
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/chats/notification"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "chat_id": 15,
    "user_id": 5,
    "is_delete": 1
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "msg": "Notification deleted successfully",
    "status": true
}

Example response (200):


{
    "msg": "Notification already sent",
    "status": true,
    "notification_count": 3,
    "notification": {
        "id": 45,
        "user_id": 3,
        "chat_id": 15,
        "message": "You have a <b>new message</b> from John Doe",
        "type": "Chat",
        "created_at": "2024-11-07T14:35:29.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-07T14:35:29.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (200):


{
    "msg": "Notification sent successfully",
    "status": true,
    "notification_count": 4,
    "notification": {
        "id": 46,
        "user_id": 3,
        "chat_id": 15,
        "message": "You have a <b>new message</b> from John Doe",
        "type": "Chat",
        "created_at": "2024-11-07T14:35:29.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-07T14:35:29.000000Z"
    }
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/chats/notification

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

chat_id   integer   

The ID of the chat message related to the notification. Example: 15

user_id   integer   

The ID of the receiver of the chat message. Example: 5

is_delete   integer  optional  

optional Set to 1 to mark the notification as deleted. Example: 1

Contact Us

Store Contact Us

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/contact-us" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"first_name\": \"John\",
    \"last_name\": \"Doe\",
    \"email\": \"gerlach.madonna@example.org\",
    \"phone\": \"1234567890\",
    \"message\": \"Hello\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/contact-us"
);

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "first_name": "John",
    "last_name": "Doe",
    "email": "gerlach.madonna@example.org",
    "phone": "1234567890",
    "message": "Hello"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Thank you for contacting us",
    "status": true
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/contact-us

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

first_name   string   

First Name of the user. Example: John

last_name   string   

Last Name of the user. Example: Doe

email   string   

Email of the user. Example: Example: gerlach.madonna@example.org

phone   string   

Phone of the user. Example: 1234567890

message   string   

Message of the user. Example: Hello

Donation

Donation Api

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/donation" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"first_name\": \"Robert Hyde\",
    \"last_name\": \"Hyde\",
    \"email\": \"hyde@yopmail.com\",
    \"address\": \"New york\",
    \"city\": \"New york\",
    \"state\": \"London\",
    \"postcode\": \"ZP74857\",
    \"amount\": 150,
    \"country_id\": 2,
    \"stripeToken\": \"quia\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/donation"
);

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "first_name": "Robert Hyde",
    "last_name": "Hyde",
    "email": "hyde@yopmail.com",
    "address": "New york",
    "city": "New york",
    "state": "London",
    "postcode": "ZP74857",
    "amount": 150,
    "country_id": 2,
    "stripeToken": "quia"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/donation

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

first_name   string  optional  

required. Example: Robert Hyde

last_name   string  optional  

required. Example: Hyde

email   string  optional  

required. Example: hyde@yopmail.com

address   string  optional  

required. Example: New york

city   string  optional  

required. Example: New york

state   string  optional  

required. Example: London

postcode   string  optional  

required. Example: ZP74857

amount   integer  optional  

required. Example: 150

country_id   integer  optional  

required. The country_id of the country. Example: 2

stripeToken   string  optional  

required. Example: quia

E-store

Fetch Products

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/e-store/all-products" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/e-store/all-products"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Education

Topics

APIs for managing topics in the system.

Topic Lists

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/topics" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/topics"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
   "data": {
       "current_page": 1,
       "data": [
           {
               "id": 11,
               "topic_name": "Third Topic",
               "education_type": "Becoming a Leader",
               "created_at": "2024-09-09T11:10:22.000000Z",
               "updated_at": "2024-09-09T11:10:22.000000Z"
           },
           {
               "id": 10,
               "topic_name": "Third Topic",
               "education_type": "Becoming Christ Like",

       ],

               "url": null,
               "label": "&laquo; Previous",
               "active": false
           },

               "active": true
           },

               "url": null,
               "label": "Next &raquo;",
               "active": false
           }
       ],
       "next_page_url": null,
       "path": "http:\/\/127.0.0.1:8000\/api\/v3\/user\/topics",

       "prev_page_url": null,
       "to": 8,
       "total": 8
   },

Create Topic

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/topics" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"topic_name\": \"\\\"Sample Topic\\\"\",
    \"education_type\": \"\\\"General\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/topics"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "topic_name": "\"Sample Topic\"",
    "education_type": "\"General\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Topic created successfully.",
    "status": true
}

Example response (400):


{
    "message": "Validation failed for the provided data.",
    "status": false
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Headers

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

topic_name   string   

The name of the topic. Example: "Sample Topic"

education_type   string   

The type of education. Example: "General"

Update Topic

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request PUT \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/topics/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"topic_name\": \"\\\"Updated Topic\\\"\",
    \"education_type\": \"\\\"General\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/topics/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "topic_name": "\"Updated Topic\"",
    "education_type": "\"General\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "PUT",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Topic updated successfully.",
    "status": true
}

Example response (400):


{
    "message": "Validation failed for the provided data.",
    "status": false
}

If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Becoming Sovereign

APIs for managing becoming sovereign files and topics.

Becoming Sovereigns List

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-sovereign?topic=1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-sovereign"
);

const params = {
    "topic": "1",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


*{
   "data": {
       "current_page": 1,
       "data": [

           {
               "id": 60,
               "user_id": 1,
               "file_name": "topic- Back to the Basics Description and Outline.docx",
               "file_extension": "docx",

               "type": "Becoming Sovereign",

               "created_at": "2024-08-02T09:32:31.000000Z",
               "updated_at": "2024-08-02T09:32:31.000000Z"
           },
           {
               "id": 59,
               "user_id": 1,
               "file_name": "topic-Back to the Basics Part 1.pptx",
               "file_extension": "pptx",
               "topic_id": 4,
               "type": "Becoming Sovereign",
               "file": "files\/bv7C4BiH0N1s8WXrVZpPV2s6YTWN5sVUQs5PE584.pptx",
               "created_at": "2024-08-02T09:31:40.000000Z",
               "updated_at": "2024-08-02T09:31:40.000000Z"

               "id": 57,

List by Topic

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-sovereign/list-by-topics?sortby=magni&sorttype=dolor&query=quia&topic_id=1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-sovereign/list-by-topics"
);

const params = {
    "sortby": "magni",
    "sorttype": "dolor",
    "query": "quia",
    "topic_id": "1",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Files retrieved successfully.",
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 77,
            "user_id": 37,
            "file_name": "image.png",
            "file_extension": "png",
            "topic_id": 13,
            "type": "Becoming Sovereign",
            "file": "files/WoKa3ViZP3eoU6cqhAqcBqBdVfeGgGADoPS5c8WK.png",
            "created_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z"
        }
    ],
    "pagination": {
        "total": 1,
        "per_page": 15,
        "current_page": 1,
        "last_page": 1
    },
    "status": true
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/v3/user/becoming-sovereign/list-by-topics

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

sortby   string  optional  

The column to sort by (optional, default: id). Example: magni

sorttype   string  optional  

The sort direction, either 'asc' or 'desc' (optional, default: 'asc'). Example: dolor

query   string  optional  

The search query to filter files by ID, file name, or file extension (optional). Example: quia

topic_id   integer  optional  

The ID of the topic to filter files by (optional). Example: 1

Get List of Topics

requires authentication

Example request:

    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-sovereign/topics" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"

    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-sovereign/topics"
);

    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Request      

GET api/v3/user/becoming-sovereign/topics

Example: application/json

Create New

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-sovereign/store" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "topic_id=0"\
    --form "file=@/private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpWVhfhR" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-sovereign/store"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('topic_id', '0');
body.append('file', document.querySelector('input[name="file"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "File uploaded successfully.",
    "data": {
        "user_id": 37,
        "file_name": "image.png",
        "file_extension": "png",
        "topic_id": "13",
        "type": "Becoming Sovereign",
        "file": "files/WoKa3ViZP3eoU6cqhAqcBqBdVfeGgGADoPS5c8WK.png",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z",
        "created_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z",
        "id": 77
    },
    "status": true
}

Example response (400):


{
    "message": "The file name has already been taken.",
    "status": false
}

Example response (422):


{
    "message": "Validation errors occurred.",
    "errors": {
        "file": [
            "The file field is required."
        ],
        "topic_id": [
            "The topic id field is required."
        ]
    },
    "status": false
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/becoming-sovereign/store

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

file   file   

The file to upload. Example: /private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpWVhfhR

topic_id   integer   

The ID of the topic to associate the file with. Example: 0

requires authentication

Example request:

    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-sovereign/view/1?topic=2" \

    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"

    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-sovereign/view/1"
);

    "topic": "2",
};

    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

        "file_extension": "png",
        "topic_id": 13,
        "type": "Becoming Sovereign",
        "file": "files/WoKa3ViZP3eoU6cqhAqcBqBdVfeGgGADoPS5c8WK.png",
        "created_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z"
    },
    "new_topic": "",
    "status": true

Update File

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-sovereign/update/et" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "topic_id=1"\
    --form "file=@/private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpK8TMHH" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-sovereign/update/et"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('topic_id', '1');
body.append('file', document.querySelector('input[name="file"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "File updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "file_name": "updated_sample.pdf",
        "file_extension": "pdf",
        "topic_id": 1,
        "user_id": 1,
        "file": "updated_file_path_here"
    },
    "status": true
}

Example response (400):


{
    "message": "Validation failed.",
    "errors": {
        "file": [
            "The file name has already been taken."
        ]
    },
    "status": false
}

Example response (404):


{
    "message": "File not found.",
    "status": false
}

Example response (500):


{
    "message": "Something went wrong. Please try again later.",
    "status": false
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/becoming-sovereign/update/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   string   

The ID of the update. Example: et

Body Parameters

file   file  optional  

The new file to replace the existing one (optional). Example: /private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpK8TMHH

topic_id   integer   

The ID of the topic to associate with the file. Example: 1

    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-sovereign/download/quasi"

    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


A downloadable file response with the specified file.

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "File not found.",
    "status": false
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "Something went wrong. Please try again later.",
    "status": false
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Accept

Example: quasi

Becoming Christ Like

APIs for managing Becoming Christ Like files and topics.

Becoming Christ Likes List

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-christ-like?topic=1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-christ-like"
);

const params = {
    "topic": "1",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


*{
   "data": {
       "current_page": 1,
       "data": [

           {
               "id": 60,
               "user_id": 1,
               "file_name": "topic- Back to the Basics Description and Outline.docx",
               "file_extension": "docx",
               "topic_id": 4,
               "type": "Becoming Christ Like",
               "file": "files\/qm5d3aJ5Z6esEep7WZAs19BLo4KRsjXp9w1RITYv.docx",
               "created_at": "2024-08-02T09:32:31.000000Z",
               "updated_at": "2024-08-02T09:32:31.000000Z"
           },
           {
               "id": 59,
               "user_id": 1,
               "file_name": "topic-Back to the Basics Part 1.pptx",
               "file_extension": "pptx",
               "topic_id": 4,
               "type": "Becoming Christ Like",
               "file": "files\/bv7C4BiH0N1s8WXrVZpPV2s6YTWN5sVUQs5PE584.pptx",
               "created_at": "2024-08-02T09:31:40.000000Z",
               "updated_at": "2024-08-02T09:31:40.000000Z"
           },
           {
               "id": 57,
               "user_id": 1,
               "file_name": "topic-Back to the Basics Part 3.pptx",
               "file_extension": "pptx",

               "updated_at": "2024-08-02T09:29:56.000000Z"

Request      

GET api/v3/user/becoming-christ-like

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

topic   integer  optional  

The ID of the topic to filter by. Example: 1

List by Topic

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-christ-like/list-by-topics?sortby=ea&sorttype=voluptas&query=minima&topic_id=9" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-christ-like/list-by-topics"
);

const params = {
    "sortby": "ea",
    "sorttype": "voluptas",
    "query": "minima",
    "topic_id": "9",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Files retrieved successfully.",
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 77,
            "user_id": 37,
            "file_name": "image.png",
            "file_extension": "png",
            "topic_id": 13,
            "type": "Becoming Christ Like",
            "file": "files/WoKa3ViZP3eoU6cqhAqcBqBdVfeGgGADoPS5c8WK.png",
            "created_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z"
        }
    ],
    "pagination": {
        "total": 1,
        "per_page": 15,
        "current_page": 1,
        "last_page": 1
    },
    "status": true
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/v3/user/becoming-christ-like/list-by-topics

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

sortby   string  optional  

The column to sort by (optional, default: id). Example: ea

sorttype   string  optional  

The sort direction, either 'asc' or 'desc' (optional, default: 'asc'). Example: voluptas

query   string  optional  

The search query to filter files by ID, file name, or file extension (optional). Example: minima

topic_id   integer  optional  

The ID of the topic to filter files by (optional). Example: 9

Get List of Topics

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-christ-like/topics" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-christ-like/topics"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

    "data": [

            "id": 1,

    ],

Create New

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-christ-like/store" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "topic_id=0"\
    --form "file=@/private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpiCZVIn" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-christ-like/store"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('topic_id', '0');
body.append('file', document.querySelector('input[name="file"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "File uploaded successfully.",
    "data": {
        "user_id": 37,
        "file_name": "image.png",
        "file_extension": "png",
        "topic_id": "13",
        "type": "Becoming Christ Like",
        "file": "files/WoKa3ViZP3eoU6cqhAqcBqBdVfeGgGADoPS5c8WK.png",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z",
        "created_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z",
        "id": 77
    },
    "status": true
}

Example response (400):


{
    "message": "The file name has already been taken.",
    "status": false
}

Example response (422):


{
    "message": "Validation errors occurred.",
    "errors": {
        "file": [
            "The file field is required."
        ],
        "topic_id": [
            "The topic id field is required."
        ]
    },
    "status": false
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/becoming-christ-like/store

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

file   file   

The file to upload. Example: /private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpiCZVIn

topic_id   integer   

The ID of the topic to associate the file with. Example: 0

View File

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-christ-like/view/1?topic=2" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"

    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-christ-like/view/1"
);

    "topic": "2",
};

    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

    "message": "File details retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 77,
        "user_id": 37,
        "file_name": "image.png",
        "file_extension": "png",
        "topic_id": 13,
        "type": "Becoming Christ Like",
        "file": "files/WoKa3ViZP3eoU6cqhAqcBqBdVfeGgGADoPS5c8WK.png",
        "created_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z"
    },
    "new_topic": "",
    "status": true
}

    "status": false
