Update File

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-christ-like/update/ipsum" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "topic_id=1"\
    --form "file=@/private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpN92yM9" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/becoming-christ-like/update/ipsum"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('topic_id', '1');
body.append('file', document.querySelector('input[name="file"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "File updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "file_name": "updated_sample.pdf",
        "file_extension": "pdf",
        "topic_id": 1,
        "user_id": 1,
        "file": "updated_file_path_here"
    },
    "status": true
}

Example response (400):


{
    "message": "Validation failed.",
    "errors": {
        "file": [
            "The file name has already been taken."
        ]
    },
    "status": false
}

Example response (404):


{
    "message": "File not found.",
    "status": false
}

Example response (500):


{
    "message": "Something went wrong. Please try again later.",
    "status": false
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/becoming-christ-like/update/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   string   

The ID of the update. Example: ipsum

Body Parameters

file   file  optional  

The new file to replace the existing one (optional). Example: /private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpN92yM9

topic_id   integer   

The ID of the topic to associate with the file. Example: 1

    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \

Becoming a Leaders List

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/leadership-development?topic=1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/leadership-development"
);

const params = {
    "topic": "1",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Request      

GET api/v3/user/leadership-development

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

topic   integer  optional  

The ID of the topic to filter by. Example: 1

List by Topic

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/leadership-development/list-by-topics?sortby=veniam&sorttype=quo&query=quia&topic_id=14" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/leadership-development/list-by-topics"
);

const params = {
    "sortby": "veniam",
    "sorttype": "quo",
    "query": "quia",
    "topic_id": "14",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Files retrieved successfully.",
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 77,
            "user_id": 37,
            "file_name": "image.png",
            "file_extension": "png",
            "topic_id": 13,
            "type": "Becoming a Leader",
            "file": "files/WoKa3ViZP3eoU6cqhAqcBqBdVfeGgGADoPS5c8WK.png",
            "created_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z"
        }
    ],
    "pagination": {
        "total": 1,
        "per_page": 15,
        "current_page": 1,
        "last_page": 1
    },
    "status": true
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/v3/user/leadership-development/list-by-topics

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

sortby   string  optional  

The column to sort by (optional, default: id). Example: veniam

sorttype   string  optional  

The sort direction, either 'asc' or 'desc' (optional, default: 'asc'). Example: quo

query   string  optional  

The search query to filter files by ID, file name, or file extension (optional). Example: quia

topic_id   integer  optional  

The ID of the topic to filter files by (optional). Example: 14

Get List of Topics

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/leadership-development/topics" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/leadership-development/topics"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "topic_name": "Sample Topic",
            "education_type": "Becoming a Leader",
            "created_at": "2024-09-09T11:02:39.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-09-09T11:02:39.000000Z"
        }
    ],
    "status": true
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "Failed to fetch topics. Please try again later.",
    "status": false
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/v3/user/leadership-development/topics

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Create New

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/leadership-development/store" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "topic_id=0"\
    --form "file=@/private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpWwRTAx" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/leadership-development/store"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('topic_id', '0');
body.append('file', document.querySelector('input[name="file"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "File uploaded successfully.",
    "data": {
        "user_id": 37,
        "file_name": "image.png",
        "file_extension": "png",
        "topic_id": "13",
        "type": "Becoming a Leader",
        "file": "files/WoKa3ViZP3eoU6cqhAqcBqBdVfeGgGADoPS5c8WK.png",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z",
        "created_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z",
        "id": 77
    },
    "status": true
}

Example response (400):


{
    "message": "The file name has already been taken.",
    "status": false
}

Example response (422):


{
    "message": "Validation errors occurred.",
    "errors": {
        "file": [
            "The file field is required."
        ],
        "topic_id": [
            "The topic id field is required."
        ]
    },
    "status": false
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/leadership-development/store

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

file   file   

The file to upload. Example: /private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpWwRTAx

topic_id   integer   

The ID of the topic to associate the file with. Example: 0

View File

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/leadership-development/view/1?topic=14" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/leadership-development/view/1"
);

const params = {
    "topic": "14",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "File details retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 77,
        "user_id": 37,
        "file_name": "image.png",
        "file_extension": "png",
        "topic_id": 13,
        "type": "Becoming a Leader",
        "file": "files/WoKa3ViZP3eoU6cqhAqcBqBdVfeGgGADoPS5c8WK.png",
        "created_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z"
    },
    "new_topic": "",
    "status": true
}

Example response (404):


{
    "message": "File not found.",
    "status": false
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

Update File

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/leadership-development/update/est" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "topic_id=1"\
    --form "file=@/private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpuJZML0" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/leadership-development/update/est"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('topic_id', '1');
body.append('file', document.querySelector('input[name="file"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "File updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "file_name": "updated_sample.pdf",
        "file_extension": "pdf",
        "topic_id": 1,
        "user_id": 1,
        "file": "updated_file_path_here"
    },
    "status": true
}

Example response (400):


{
    "message": "Validation failed.",
    "errors": {
        "file": [
            "The file name has already been taken."
        ]
    },
    "status": false
}

Example response (404):


{
    "message": "File not found.",
    "status": false
}

Example response (500):


{
    "message": "Something went wrong. Please try again later.",
    "status": false
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/leadership-development/update/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   string   

The ID of the update. Example: est

Body Parameters

file   file  optional  

The new file to replace the existing one (optional). Example: /private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpuJZML0

topic_id   integer   

The ID of the topic to associate with the file. Example: 1

    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"

Files

APIs for managing files.

Files List

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/files?topic=1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/files"
);

const params = {
    "topic": "1",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


*{
   "data": {
       "current_page": 1,
       "data": [

           {
               "id": 60,

               "updated_at": "2024-08-02T09:32:31.000000Z"

GET api/v3/user/files

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

topic   integer  optional  

The ID of the topic to filter by. Example: 1

List by Topic

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/files/list-by-topics?sortby=nostrum&sorttype=eligendi&query=sequi&topic_id=1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/files/list-by-topics"
);

const params = {
    "sortby": "nostrum",
    "sorttype": "eligendi",
    "query": "sequi",
    "topic_id": "1",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Files retrieved successfully.",
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 77,
            "user_id": 37,
            "file_name": "image.png",
            "file_extension": "png",
            "topic_id": 13,
            "type": "Becoming Christ Like",
            "file": "files/WoKa3ViZP3eoU6cqhAqcBqBdVfeGgGADoPS5c8WK.png",
            "created_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z"
        }
    ],
    "pagination": {
        "total": 1,
        "per_page": 15,
        "current_page": 1,
        "last_page": 1
    },
    "status": true
}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

sortby   string  optional  

The column to sort by (optional, default: id). Example: nostrum

sorttype   string  optional  

The sort direction, either 'asc' or 'desc' (optional, default: 'asc'). Example: eligendi

query   string  optional  

The search query to filter files by ID, file name, or file extension (optional). Example: sequi

topic_id   integer  optional  

The ID of the topic to filter files by (optional). Example: 1

);

    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",

    "message": "File uploaded successfully.",
    "data": {
        "user_id": 37,
        "file_name": "image.png",
        "file_extension": "png",
        "topic_id": "13",
        "type": "Becoming Christ Like",
        "file": "files/WoKa3ViZP3eoU6cqhAqcBqBdVfeGgGADoPS5c8WK.png",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z",
        "created_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z",
        "id": 77
    },
    "status": true
}

Example response (400):


{
    "message": "The file name has already been taken.",
    "status": false
}

Example response (422):


{
    "message": "Validation errors occurred.",
    "errors": {
        "file": [
            "The file field is required."
        ],
        "topic_id": [
            "The topic id field is required."
        ]
    },
    "status": false
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/files/store

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

file   file   

The file to upload. Example: /private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpyKsWas

topic_id   integer   

The ID of the topic to associate the file with. Example: 0

View File

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/files/view/1?topic=4" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/files/view/1"
);

const params = {
    "topic": "4",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "File details retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 77,
        "user_id": 37,
        "file_name": "image.png",
        "file_extension": "png",
        "topic_id": 13,
        "type": "Becoming Christ Like",
        "file": "files/WoKa3ViZP3eoU6cqhAqcBqBdVfeGgGADoPS5c8WK.png",
        "created_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-08T11:01:16.000000Z"
    },
    "new_topic": "",
    "status": true
}

Example response (404):


{
    "message": "File not found.",
    "status": false
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/v3/user/files/view/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the file to view. Example: 1

Query Parameters

topic   integer  optional  

The ID of the topic to filter by (optional). Example: 4

Update File

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/files/update/suscipit" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "topic_id=1"\
    --form "file=@/private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpplXtYL" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/files/update/suscipit"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('topic_id', '1');
body.append('file', document.querySelector('input[name="file"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "File updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "file_name": "updated_sample.pdf",
        "file_extension": "pdf",
        "topic_id": 1,
        "user_id": 1,
        "file": "updated_file_path_here"
    },
    "status": true
}

Example response (400):


{
    "message": "Validation failed.",
    "errors": {
        "file": [
            "The file name has already been taken."
        ]
    },
    "status": false
}

Example response (404):


{
    "message": "File not found.",
    "status": false
}

Example response (500):


{
    "message": "Something went wrong. Please try again later.",
    "status": false
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/files/update/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   string   

The ID of the update. Example: suscipit

Body Parameters

file   file  optional  

The new file to replace the existing one (optional). Example: /private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpplXtYL

topic_id   integer   

The ID of the topic to associate with the file. Example: 1

requires authentication

Example request:

    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/files/delete/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"

    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/files/delete/1"
);

    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

    "status": true

    --header "Accept: application/json"

    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

    "status": false

Example: application/json

file   string   

Example: ut

Email

Inbox Emails

requires authentication

API for fetching the inbox email list for the authenticated user.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/inbox-email-list?type=%22unread%22&search=%22abc%22" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/inbox-email-list"
);

const params = {
    "type": ""unread"",
    "search": ""abc"",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "subject": "Hello World",
            "message": "This is a sample message.",
            "userToNames": "John Doe, Jane Smith",
            "lastReplyMessage": "See you soon!",
            "lastReplyDate": "2024-11-29 10:00:00",
            "ownUserMailInfo": {
                "is_read": true,
                "is_delete": false
            }
        }
    ],
    "total": 25,
    "perPage": 15,
    "currentPage": 1,
    "lastPage": 2
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "Unable to fetch inbox email list.",
    "error": "Detailed error message."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/mail/inbox-email-list

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

type   string  optional  

The type of emails to filter. Example: "unread"

search   string  optional  

optional for search. Example: "abc"

Sent Emails

requires authentication

API for fetching the sent email list for the authenticated user.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/sent-email-list?type=%22draft%22" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/sent-email-list"
);

const params = {
    "type": ""draft"",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "subject": "Project Update",
            "message": "Here is the latest update.",
            "userToNames": "Alice Johnson, Bob Williams",
            "lastReplyMessage": "Noted, thanks!",
            "lastReplyDate": "2024-11-29 12:00:00",
            "ownUserMailInfo": {
                "is_read": true,
                "is_delete": false
            }
        }
    ],
    "total": 30,
    "perPage": 15,
    "currentPage": 1,
    "lastPage": 2
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "Unable to fetch sent email list.",
    "error": "Detailed error message."
}

Request failed with error:

If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.

    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",

    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/trash-email-list?type=%22archived%22" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/trash-email-list"
);

    "type": ""archived"",
};

    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

    "data": [

            "lastReplyDate": "2024-11-29 15:00:00",
            "ownUserMailInfo": {
                "is_read": true,
                "is_delete": true
            }
        }
    ],

View Email Details

requires authentication

Retrieves the details of a specific email along with its replies and user-specific information for the authenticated user.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/view" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"mail_id\": 1
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/view"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "mail_id": 1
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Email details retrieved successfully.",
    "status": true,
    "data": {
        "mail_details": {
            "id": 72,
            "reply_of": null,
            "form_id": 37,
            "to": "swarnadwip@excellisit.net",
            "cc": null,
            "subject": "Test Email 10",
            "message": "<p>10 msg</p>",
            "attachment": "[{\"original_name\":\"p3.pdf\",\"encrypted_name\":\"email_files\\/MG0hSy05bAv8Codx59IoDWjNxvid173ie4oWOgIh.pdf\"},{\"original_name\":\"image.png\",\"encrypted_name\":\"email_files\\/O5ouE0bgXqG0TDXMhaz1loGLVwUXalYGprPn62K9.png\"},{\"original_name\":\"dummy - 2.pdf\",\"encrypted_name\":\"email_files\\/l6PwXoc6aGTX80y1LoVb82QadlKnCEx9W4N25zlI.pdf\"}]",
            "is_draft": 0,
            "is_delete": 0,
            "deleted_at": null,
            "created_at": "2024-11-06T05:27:05.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-11-06T05:27:05.000000Z",

                "id": 37,

Compose Emails

requires authentication

This endpoint retrieves a list of active users, excluding the currently authenticated user, that can be recipients of a new mail.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/compose-mail-users" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/compose-mail-users"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Users loaded successfully.",
    "status": true,
    "users": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "email": "user1@example.com"
        },
        {
            "id": 2,
            "email": "user2@example.com"
        }
    ]
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "You do not have permission to access this page.",
    "status": false
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while loading the compose mail users.",
    "status": false,
    "error": "Exception message details"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/mail/compose-mail-users

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Send New Email

requires authentication

This endpoint allows the authenticated user to send an email to specified recipients, with the option to include CC recipients and attachments. Notifications are sent to recipients as well.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/send" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "to=qui"\
    --form "cc=quibusdam"\
    --form "subject=corrupti"\
    --form "message=reprehenderit"\
    --form "attachments[]=@/private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpNKBClZ" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/send"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('to', 'qui');
body.append('cc', 'quibusdam');
body.append('subject', 'corrupti');
body.append('message', 'reprehenderit');
body.append('attachments[]', document.querySelector('input[name="attachments[]"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Mail sent successfully.",
    "status": true,
    "send_to_ids": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ],
    "notification_message": "You have a <b>new mail</b> from sender@example.com"
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "Failed to send mail. Please try again later.",
    "status": false,
    "error": "Error message here"
}

Example response (422):


{
    "message": "Validation error",
    "errors": {
        "to": [
            "The to field is required."
        ],
        "subject": [
            "The subject field is required."
        ],
        "message": [
            "The message field is required."
        ]
    }
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/mail/send

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

to   string   

JSON-encoded array of recipient emails in the format [{"value": "masum2@excellisit.net"}, {"value": "user2@example.com"}]. Example: qui

cc   string  optional  

JSON-encoded array of CC recipient emails in the same format as the "to" field. Optional. Example: quibusdam

subject   string   

The subject of the email. Example: corrupti

message   string   

The body content of the email. Example: reprehenderit

attachments   file[]  optional  

Attachments in file format. Accepted formats: jpg, jpeg, png, pdf, doc, docx. Max size: 2MB each. Optional.

Send Reply Email

requires authentication

This endpoint allows the authenticated user to reply to an existing email thread, including attachments and notifications to recipients.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/sendReply" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "to=corporis"\
    --form "cc=odio"\
    --form "subject=libero"\
    --form "message=rem"\
    --form "main_mail_id=19"\
    --form "attachments[]=@/private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpiBBEzk" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/sendReply"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('to', 'corporis');
body.append('cc', 'odio');
body.append('subject', 'libero');
body.append('message', 'rem');
body.append('main_mail_id', '19');
body.append('attachments[]', document.querySelector('input[name="attachments[]"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Mail sent successfully.",
    "status": true,
    "send_to_ids": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ],
    "notification_message": "You have a <b>new mail</b> from sender@example.com"
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "Failed to send mail. Please try again later.",
    "status": false,
    "error": "Error message here"
}

Example response (422):


{
    "message": "Validation error",
    "errors": {
        "to": [
            "The to field is required."
        ],
        "subject": [
            "The subject field is required."
        ],
        "message": [
            "The message field is required."
        ],
        "main_mail_id": [
            "The main_mail_id field is required."
        ]
    }
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/mail/sendReply

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

to   string   

JSON-encoded array of recipient emails in the format [{"value": "user1@example.com"}, {"value": "user2@example.com"}]. Example: corporis

cc   string  optional  

JSON-encoded array of CC recipient emails in the same format as the "to" field. Optional. Example: odio

subject   string   

The subject of the reply email. Example: libero

message   string   

The body content of the reply email. Example: rem

attachments   file[]  optional  

Attachments in file format. Accepted formats: jpg, jpeg, png, pdf, doc, docx. Max size: 2MB each. Optional.

main_mail_id   integer   

The ID of the main email thread being replied to. Example: 19

Forward Email

requires authentication

This endpoint allows the authenticated user to forward an existing email to a list of recipients, including optional CC recipients and attachments.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/sendForward" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "to=at"\
    --form "cc=quis"\
    --form "subject=et"\
    --form "message=quae"\
    --form "attachments[]=@/private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/php8xwmqE" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/sendForward"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('to', 'at');
body.append('cc', 'quis');
body.append('subject', 'et');
body.append('message', 'quae');
body.append('attachments[]', document.querySelector('input[name="attachments[]"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Mail sent successfully.",
    "status": true,
    "send_to_ids": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ],
    "notification_message": "You have a <b>new mail</b> from sender@example.com"
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "Failed to send mail. Please try again later.",
    "status": false,
    "error": "Error message here"
}

Example response (422):


{
    "message": "Validation error",
    "errors": {
        "to": [
            "The to field is required."
        ],
        "subject": [
            "The subject field is required."
        ],
        "message": [
            "The message field is required."
        ]
    }
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/mail/sendForward

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

to   string   

JSON-encoded array of recipient emails in the format [{"value": "user1@example.com"}, {"value": "user2@example.com"}]. Example: at

cc   string  optional  

JSON-encoded array of CC recipient emails in the same format as the "to" field. Optional. Example: quis

subject   string   

The subject of the forwarded email. Example: et

message   string   

The body content of the forwarded email. Example: quae

attachments   file[]  optional  

Attachments in file format. Accepted formats: jpg, jpeg, png, pdf, doc, docx. Max size: 2MB each. Optional.

Delete Emails

requires authentication

This endpoint allows the authenticated user to delete multiple emails by marking them as deleted. The emails are logically deleted by setting the is_delete flag and deleted_at timestamp.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/mail-delete" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"mailIds\": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ]
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/mail-delete"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "mailIds": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ]
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Mail deleted successfully.",
    "status": true
}

Example response (404):


{
    "message": "Mail not found.",
    "status": false
}

Example response (422):


{
    "message": "Validation error.",
    "errors": {
        "mailIds": [
            "The mailIds field is required."
        ]
    }
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/mail/mail-delete

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

mailIds   string[]   

An array of mail IDs to be deleted.

Delete Sent Emails

requires authentication

This endpoint allows the authenticated user to delete multiple sent emails by marking them as deleted. The emails are logically deleted by setting the is_delete flag and deleted_at timestamp.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/mail-delete-sent" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"mailIds\": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ]
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/mail-delete-sent"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "mailIds": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ]
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Mail deleted successfully.",
    "status": true
}

Example response (404):


{
    "message": "Mail not found.",
    "status": false
}

Example response (422):


{
    "message": "Validation error.",
    "errors": {
        "mailIds": [
            "The mailIds field is required."
        ]
    }
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Example: application/json

    --header "Accept: application/json" \

    \"mailIds\": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ]

Example: application/json

Example: application/json

mailIds   string[]   

The IDs of the mails to restore.

Star Mark on a Mail

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/mail-star" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"mail_id\": 1,
    \"star_value\": 1
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/mail-star"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "mail_id": 1,
    "star_value": 1
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Mail Starred Success!",
    "status": true
}

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Mail Star Mark Removed!",
    "status": true
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "Failed to update star status. Please try again later.",
    "status": false
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/mail/mail-star

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

mail_id   integer   

The ID of the mail to be starred or unstarred. Example: 1

star_value   integer   

The star value (1 for starred, 0 for unstarred). Example: 1

    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/mail/mail-delete-single" \

    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \

    \"mail_id\": 1

Events

List All events

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/events/load?search=%22abc%22" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/events/load"
);

const params = {
    "search": ""abc"",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "user_id": 2,
            "title": "Project Sync",
            "description": "Weekly project sync event.",
            "start": "2024-11-10T09:00:00.000000Z",
            "end": "2024-11-10T10:00:00.000000Z",
            "created_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
            "user": {
                "id": 2,
                "name": "John Doe",
                "email": "john@example.com"
            }
        }
    ]
}

Example response (201):


{
    "error": "Failed to load events."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/v3/user/events/load

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

search   string  optional  

optional for search. Example: "abc"

Create event

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/events/store" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"title\": \"Project Sync\",
    \"description\": \"Weekly project sync event.\",
    \"start\": \"2024-11-22T01:25\",
    \"end\": \"2024-11-23T01:25\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/events/store"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "title": "Project Sync",
    "description": "Weekly project sync event.",
    "start": "2024-11-22T01:25",
    "end": "2024-11-23T01:25"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "event created successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "user_id": 2,
        "title": "Project Sync",
        "description": "Weekly project sync event.",
        "start": "2024-11-22T01:25",
        "end": "2024-11-23T01:25",
        "created_at": "2024-11-22T01:25",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-22T01:25"
    }
}

Example response (201):


{
    "error": "Failed to create event."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/events/store

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

title   string   

The title of the event. Example: Project Sync

description   string  optional  

The description of the event. Example: Weekly project sync event.

start   datetime   

The start time of the event in ISO 8601 format. Example: 2024-11-22T01:25

end   datetime   

The end time of the event in ISO 8601 format. Example: 2024-11-23T01:25

Single event Details

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/events/view/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/events/view/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "user_id": 2,
        "title": "Project Sync",
        "description": "Weekly project sync event.",
        "start": "2024-11-10T09:00:00.000000Z",
        "end": "2024-11-10T10:00:00.000000Z",
        "created_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
        "user": {
            "id": 12,
            "ecclesia_id": 2,
            "created_id": "1",
            "user_name": "swarnadwip_nath",
            "first_name": "Swarnadwip",
            "middle_name": null,
            "last_name": "Nath",
            "email": "swarnadwip@excellisit.net",
            "phone": "+1 0741202022",
            "email_verified_at": null,
            "profile_picture": "profile_picture/yCvplMhdpjc0kIeKG63tfkZwhKNYbcF1ZhfQdDFO.jpg",
            "address": "Kokata",
            "city": "Kolkata",
            "state": "41",
            "address2": null,
            "country": "101",
            "zip": "700001",
            "status": 1,
            "created_at": "2024-06-21T11:31:27.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-09-09T11:02:59.000000Z"
        }
    }
}

Example response (404):


{
    "error": "event not found."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/v3/user/events/view/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the event. Example: 1

Update event

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/events/edit/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"title\": \"Project Sync Update\",
    \"description\": \"Updated project sync event.\",
    \"start\": \"2024-11-22T01:25\",
    \"end\": \"2024-11-23T01:25\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/events/edit/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "title": "Project Sync Update",
    "description": "Updated project sync event.",
    "start": "2024-11-22T01:25",
    "end": "2024-11-23T01:25"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "event updated successfully.",
    "status": true
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/events/edit/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the event. Example: 1

Body Parameters

title   string   

The title of the event. Example: Project Sync Update

description   string  optional  

The description of the event. Example: Updated project sync event.

start   datetime   

The updated start time in ISO 8601 format. Example: 2024-11-22T01:25

end   datetime   

The updated end time in ISO 8601 format. Example: 2024-11-23T01:25

Delete event

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/events/delete/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/events/delete/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "event deleted successfully",
    "status": true
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/events/delete/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the event. Example: 1

Events Calender Data

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/events/event-calender-fetch-data" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/events/event-calender-fetch-data"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
   "message": "Calender data fetched successfully.",
   "data": [
       {
           "id": 15,
           "title": "Project Sync",

           "end": "2024-11-10T10:00:00.000000Z",
       },

           "id": 13,

       },

           "id": 12,
           "title": "Third event",
           "description": "fd",
           "start": "2024-10-01T18:57",
           "end": "2024-10-01T18:58",
       },
       {
           "id": 11,
           "title": "Second event",
           "description": "adsf",
           "start": "2024-10-01T18:56",
           "end": "2024-10-01T18:57",
       }
   ]
}

Forget Password

Forget Password

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/forget-password" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"email\": \"frosenbaum@example.net\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/forget-password"
);

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "email": "frosenbaum@example.net"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Password reset link sent to your email"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/forget-password

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

email   string   

The email of the user. Example: Example: frosenbaum@example.net

Group Chats

List of Group Chats

requires authentication

Retrieves the list of teams that the authenticated user is part of, ordered by the last message sent in the team. It also includes the team members.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/list" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/list"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):

Request

Create a New Group

requires authentication

Creates a new group with the specified members and a welcome message. The authenticated user will be set as the group admin.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/create" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "name="Project Z Team""\
    --form "description="Team for Project Z collaboration""\
    --form "members="\
    --form "group_image=@/private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpGq2vVP" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/create"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('name', '"Project Z Team"');
body.append('description', '"Team for Project Z collaboration"');
body.append('members', '');
body.append('group_image', document.querySelector('input[name="group_image"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


*{
   "message": "Team created successfully.",
   "status": true,
   "team": {
       "id": 33,
       "created_by": null,
       "name": "abc",
       "group_image": "team/hEjqR3bR46pdpRncBqugbo9aZNC7gFVkNNi9cMzG.png",
       "description": "test 2",
       "created_at": "2024-11-07T10:32:47.000000Z",
       "updated_at": "2024-11-07T10:32:47.000000Z",
       "last_message": {
           "id": 283,
           "team_id": 33,
           "user_id": 37,
           "message": "Welcome to abc group.",
           "attachment": null,
           "is_seen": 0,
           "deleted_at": null,
           "created_at": "2024-11-07T10:32:47.000000Z",
           "updated_at": "2024-11-07T10:32:47.000000Z"
       }
   },
   "chat_member_id": [
       12,
       38,
       37
   ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/team-chats/create

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

name   string   

The name of the team. Example: "Project Z Team"

description   string   

A brief description of the team. Example: "Team for Project Z collaboration"

members   integer[]   

The IDs of the users to be added to the group.

group_image   file   

An image file for the team group. Supported formats: jpeg, png, jpg, gif, svg. Maximum size: 2MB. Example: /private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpGq2vVP

Load Specific Group Chats

requires authentication

Retrieves a team's information and chat history for the authenticated user, along with member details.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/load" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"team_id\": 5
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/load"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "team_id": 5
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "team": {
        "id": 32,
        "created_by": null,
        "name": "abc 1",
        "group_image": "team/S7oRcO09C1lQad6zaPE8JgU1vrwnRY7fhiMQLCpj.png",
        "description": "test 1",
        "created_at": "2024-11-07T10:16:41.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-07T10:16:41.000000Z",
        "members": [
            {
                "id": 118,
                "team_id": 32,
                "user_id": 37,
                "is_removed": 0,
                "is_admin": 1,
                "is_removed_at": null,
                "created_at": "2024-11-07T10:16:41.000000Z",
                "updated_at": "2024-11-07T10:16:41.000000Z",
                "user": {
                    "id": 37,
                    "ecclesia_id": 4,
                    "created_id": null,
                    "user_name": "masum1",
                    "first_name": "masum",
                    "middle_name": null,
                    "last_name": "ali",
                    "email": "masum@excellisit.net",
                    "phone": "+91 9123456789",

                    "status": 1,

                }

                "id": 119,
