Request      

POST api/v3/user/team-chats/load

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

team_id   integer   

The ID of the team to load chats from. Example: 5

Send Group Chat Message

requires authentication

Sends a message or attachment to a group chat for the authenticated user. If a file is provided, it will be uploaded as an attachment; otherwise, the message text will be sent.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/send" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "team_id=5"\
    --form "message="Hello team!""\
    --form "file=@/private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpLnmO5M" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/send"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('team_id', '5');
body.append('message', '"Hello team!"');
body.append('file', document.querySelector('input[name="file"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Message sent successfully.",
    "status": true,
    "chat": {
        "id": 289,
        "team_id": 32,
        "user_id": 37,
        "message": "hello teams",
        "attachment": null,
        "is_seen": 0,
        "deleted_at": null,
        "created_at": "2024-11-07T11:23:20.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-07T11:23:20.000000Z",
        "user": {
            "id": 37,
            "ecclesia_id": 4,
            "created_id": null,
            "user_name": "masum1",
            "first_name": "Test",
            "middle_name": null,
            "last_name": "User",
            "email": "masum@excellisit.net",
            "phone": "+91 9123456789",
            "email_verified_at": "2024-10-28T08:35:17.000000Z",
            "profile_picture": "profile_picture/sLWWnksqS6PHYMdZeBQ4OK3SnbVA0oMc9oykPbCn.webp",
            "address": "kolkata",
            "city": "kolkata",
            "state": "41",
            "address2": "kolkata",
            "country": "101",
            "zip": "700001",
            "status": 1,
            "created_at": "2024-10-28T08:35:17.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-11-06T07:42:16.000000Z"
        },
        "chat_members": [
            {
                "id": 949,
                "chat_id": 289,
                "user_id": 37,
                "is_seen": 1,
                "created_at": "2024-11-07T11:23:20.000000Z",
                "updated_at": "2024-11-07T11:23:20.000000Z"
            },
            {
                "id": 950,
                "chat_id": 289,
                "user_id": 38,
                "is_seen": 0,
                "created_at": "2024-11-07T11:23:20.000000Z",
                "updated_at": "2024-11-07T11:23:20.000000Z"
            },
            {
                "id": 951,
                "chat_id": 289,
                "user_id": 12,
                "is_seen": 0,
                "created_at": "2024-11-07T11:23:20.000000Z",
                "updated_at": "2024-11-07T11:23:20.000000Z"
            }
        ]
    },
    "chat_member_id": [
        37,
        38,
        12
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/team-chats/send

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

team_id   integer   

The ID of the team to send the message to. Example: 5

message   string  optional  

The text message to send (optional if a file is provided). Example: "Hello team!"

file   file  optional  

The attachment file to send, if applicable (optional if a message is provided). Example: /private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpLnmO5M

Get Group Information

requires authentication

Retrieves detailed information about a team, including its active members and other available users.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/group-info" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"team_id\": 5
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/group-info"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "team_id": 5
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Group information retrieved successfully.",
    "status": true,
    "team": {
        "id": 5,
        "name": "Project Alpha",
        "description": "Development team for Project Alpha",
        "members": [
            {
                "user_id": 1,
                "first_name": "John",
                "last_name": "Doe",
                "email": "john@example.com"
            },
            {
                "user_id": 2,
                "first_name": "Jane",
                "last_name": "Smith",
                "email": "jane@example.com"
            }
        ]
    },
    "available_members": [
        {
            "id": 3,
            "first_name": "Mike",
            "last_name": "Taylor"
        },
        {
            "id": 4,
            "first_name": "Alice",
            "last_name": "Brown"
        }
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/team-chats/group-info

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

team_id   integer   

The ID of the team to retrieve information for. Example: 5

Update Group Image

requires authentication

Updates the group image for a specific team.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/update-group-image" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "team_id=5"\
    --form "group_image=@/private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpx2SfOC" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/update-group-image"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('team_id', '5');
body.append('group_image', document.querySelector('input[name="group_image"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Group image updated successfully.",
    "status": true,
    "group_image": "team/image.jpg"
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while updating the group image.",
    "status": false
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/team-chats/update-group-image

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

team_id   integer   

The ID of the team whose image is being updated. Example: 5

group_image   file   

The new group image file (JPEG, PNG, JPG, GIF, SVG formats, max size: 2048KB). Example: /private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpx2SfOC

Update Group Name and Description

requires authentication

Updates the name and description of a specified team group.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/name-des-update" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"team_id\": 5,
    \"name\": \"\\\"Developers Group\\\"\",
    \"description\": \"\\\"A group for discussing development strategies.\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/name-des-update"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "team_id": 5,
    "name": "\"Developers Group\"",
    "description": "\"A group for discussing development strategies.\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Group name and description updated successfully.",
    "status": true,
    "name": "Developers Group",
    "description": "A group for discussing development strategies.",
    "team_id": 5
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while updating the group name and description.",
    "status": false
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/team-chats/name-des-update

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

team_id   integer   

The ID of the team whose name and description are being updated. Example: 5

name   string   

The new name of the team (maximum 100 characters). Example: "Developers Group"

description   string   

The new description of the team (maximum 255 characters). Example: "A group for discussing development strategies."

Remove Member from Group

requires authentication

Removes a member from a team and sends a notification to the removed user. A chat message is also created to notify the group.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/remove-member" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"team_id\": 10,
    \"user_id\": 5
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/remove-member"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "team_id": 10,
    "user_id": 5
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Member removed successfully.",
    "status": true,
    "team_id": 10,
    "user_id": 5,
    "chat": {
        "id": 15,
        "user_id": 1,
        "team_id": 10,
        "message": "John Doe has been removed from the group.",
        "created_at": "2024-11-07T14:52:36.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-07T15:05:12.000000Z"
    },
    "chat_member_id": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ],
    "notification": {
        "id": 18,
        "user_id": 5,
        "message": "You have been removed from Developers group.",
        "type": "Team",
        "created_at": "2024-11-07T15:05:12.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while removing the member from the team.",
    "status": false
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/team-chats/remove-member

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

team_id   integer   

The ID of the team from which the member will be removed. Example: 10

user_id   integer   

The ID of the user to be removed from the team. Example: 5

Add Members to Group

requires authentication

Adds new members to a team or restores previously removed members. A message is sent to the group and notifications are generated for the added members.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/add-member-team" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"team_id\": 10,
    \"members\": null
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/add-member-team"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "team_id": 10,
    "members": null
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Members added successfully.",
    "status": true,
    "team_id": 10,
    "team_member_name": "John Doe, Jane Smith",
    "chat": {
        "id": 20,
        "user_id": 1,
        "team_id": 10,
        "message": "New members added to the group. John Doe, Jane Smith",
        "created_at": "2024-11-07T15:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-07T15:35:00.000000Z"
    },
    "chat_member_id": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ],
    "already_member_arr": [
        12
    ],
    "only_added_members": [
        5,
        8
    ]
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while adding the members.",
    "status": false
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/team-chats/add-member-team

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

team_id   integer   

The ID of the team to which members will be added. Example: 10

members   integer[]   

The IDs of the users to be added to the group.

Exit from Group

requires authentication

Allows a user to exit from a group, removes from the team, checks for remaining admins, and handles the deletion of the team if no members are left.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/exit-from-group" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"team_id\": 10
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/exit-from-group"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "team_id": 10
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "You have left the group successfully.",
    "status": true,
    "team_id": 10,
    "user_id": 1,
    "team_member_name": "John Doe, Jane Smith",
    "team_delete": false,
    "team_member_id": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ]
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while leaving the group.",
    "status": false,
    "error": "Error details here"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/team-chats/exit-from-group

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

team_id   integer   

The ID of the team the user is leaving. Example: 10

Delete A Group

requires authentication

Allows the deletion of a group and its associated data, such as members and chat history, only if the authenticated user is an admin.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/delete-group" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"team_id\": 10
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/delete-group"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "team_id": 10
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Group deleted successfully.",
    "status": true,
    "team_id": 10,
    "team_member_id": [
        1,
        2,
        3
    ]
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "You must be an admin to delete this group.",
    "status": false
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while deleting the group.",
    "status": false,
    "error": "Error details here"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/team-chats/delete-group

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

team_id   integer   

The ID of the team to be deleted. Example: 10

Make a Member an Admin

requires authentication

Allows an existing admin to make another member an admin.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/make-admin" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"team_id\": 10,
    \"user_id\": 5
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/make-admin"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "team_id": 10,
    "user_id": 5
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Member made admin successfully.",
    "status": true,
    "team_id": 10,
    "user_id": 5,
    "notification": {
        "user_id": 5,
        "message": "You have been made admin of <b>ABC</b> group.",
        "type": "Team",
        "id": 279
    }
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "You must be an admin to make someone else an admin.",
    "status": false
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while making the member an admin.",
    "status": false,
    "error": "Error details here"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/team-chats/make-admin

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

team_id   integer   

The ID of the team. Example: 10

user_id   integer   

The ID of the user to be made an admin. Example: 5

Mark Group Message as Seen

requires authentication

Marks the specified chat message as seen by the authenticated user.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/seen" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"chat_id\": 15
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/seen"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "chat_id": 15
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Message seen successfully.",
    "status": true
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "Chat member not found.",
    "status": false
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while marking the message as seen.",
    "status": false,
    "error": "Error details here"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/team-chats/seen

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

chat_id   integer   

The ID of the chat message to mark as seen. Example: 15

Remove Group Chat Message

requires authentication

Deletes a chat message from the group. If del_from is set to everyone, the message is deleted for all members; otherwise, it is deleted only for the authenticated user.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/remove-chat" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"chat_id\": 25,
    \"del_from\": \"everyone\",
    \"team_id\": 10
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/remove-chat"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "chat_id": 25,
    "del_from": "everyone",
    "team_id": 10
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Chat removed successfully.",
    "status": true,
    "chat_id": 25,
    "last_message": true
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "Chat message not found.",
    "status": false
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "Chat member not found for the authenticated user.",
    "status": false
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while removing the chat message.",
    "status": false,
    "error": "Error details here"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/team-chats/remove-chat

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

chat_id   integer   

The ID of the chat message to be removed. Example: 25

del_from   string   

Determines if the chat should be deleted for everyone or just for the authenticated user. Example: everyone

team_id   integer   

The ID of the team to which the chat belongs. Example: 10

Clear All Conversation

requires authentication

Clears all chat messages for a specified group. Only admins are permitted to perform this action.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/clear-all-conversation" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"team_id\": 10
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/clear-all-conversation"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "team_id": 10
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "All conversation cleared successfully.",
    "status": true
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "You do not have permission to clear the conversation.",
    "status": false
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while clearing the conversation.",
    "status": false,
    "error": "Error details here"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/team-chats/clear-all-conversation

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

team_id   integer   

The ID of the team for which to clear the conversation. Example: 10

Notification for Group Chat

requires authentication

Manages notifications for group chat messages. If the user has a new message, it sends a notification; otherwise, it marks the notification as read.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/notification" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"team_id\": 10,
    \"chat_id\": 25,
    \"is_delete\": 10
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/team-chats/notification"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "team_id": 10,
    "chat_id": 25,
    "is_delete": 10
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
   "message": "Notification read successfully.",
   "status": true,
   "notification": {
       // Notification object details here
   },
   "notification_count": 5
}

Example response (200):


{
   "message": "Notification sent successfully.",
   "status": true,
   "notification": {
       // New notification object details here
   },
   "notification_count": 6
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "Notification not found or could not be processed.",
    "status": false
}

Example response (404):


{
    "message": "Invalid request type.",
    "status": false
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/team-chats/notification

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

team_id   integer   

The ID of the team associated with the notification. Example: 10

chat_id   integer   

The ID of the chat message. Example: 25

is_delete   integer  optional  

optional Indicates if the notification should be marked as read and deleted. Example: 10

Jobs

All Job Posts

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/jobs/load?search=%22abc%22" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/jobs/load"
);

const params = {
    "search": ""abc"",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "created_by": 2,
            "job_title": "Software Engineer",
            "job_description": "<p>Develop and maintain software applications.<p>",
            "job_type": "Full-time",
            "job_location": "Remote",
            "job_salary": "80,000 - 100,000",
            "job_experience": "3+ years",
            "contact_person": "John Doe",
            "contact_email": "johndoe@example.com",
            "list_of_values": "Team player, Good communication",
            "created_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
            "user": {
                "id": 2,
                "name": "John Doe",
                "email": "john@example.com"
            }
        },
        {
            "id": 2,
            "created_by": 3,
            "job_title": "Project Manager",
            "job_description": "Manage project timelines and deliverables.",
            "job_type": "Contract",
            "job_location": "On-site",
            "job_salary": "60,000 - 80,000",
            "job_experience": "5+ years",
            "contact_person": "Jane Smith",
            "contact_email": "janesmith@example.com",
            "list_of_values": "Leadership, Organizational skills",
            "created_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
            "user": {
                "id": 3,
                "name": "Jane Smith",
                "email": "jane@example.com"
            }
        }
    ]
}

Example response (201):


{
    "error": "Failed to load jobs."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/v3/user/jobs/load

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

search   string  optional  

optional for search. Example: "abc"

Single Job Details

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/jobs/view/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"

    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/jobs/view/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "created_by": 2,

It's also portable, extensible and easy to read and code, which is a big reason it's popular.The language also focuses on designer experience and usability, and one of its largest benefits is that it has functions in many industries and organizations. You can integrate it with<strong> C</strong> and <strong>C++</strong> for more challenging tasks. Common uses of Python include:</p><ul><li>Data visualization</li><li>Artificial intelligence and machine learning</li><li>Finance</li><li>Game development</li><li>Web development</li></ul>",
        "job_type": "Full-time",
        "job_location": "Remote",
        "job_salary": "80,000 - 100,000",
        "job_experience": "3+ years",
        "contact_person": "John Doe",
        "contact_email": "johndoe@example.com",
        "list_of_values": "Team player, Good communication",
        "created_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
        "user": {
            "id": 2,
            "name": "John Doe",
            "email": "john@example.com"

Create Job

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/jobs/store" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"job_title\": \"Software Engineer\",
    \"job_description\": \"A great job opportunity\",
    \"job_type\": \"full-time\",
    \"job_location\": \"New York\",
    \"job_salary\": \"50000\",
    \"list_of_values\": \"hourly\",
    \"currency\": \"USD\",
    \"job_experience\": \"3\",
    \"contact_person\": \"John Doe\",
    \"contact_email\": \"johndoe@example.com\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/jobs/store"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "job_title": "Software Engineer",
    "job_description": "A great job opportunity",
    "job_type": "full-time",
    "job_location": "New York",
    "job_salary": "50000",
    "list_of_values": "hourly",
    "currency": "USD",
    "job_experience": "3",
    "contact_person": "John Doe",
    "contact_email": "johndoe@example.com"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Job has been created successfully.",
    "job": {
        "id": 1,
        "job_title": "Software Engineer",
        "job_description": "A great job opportunity",
        "job_type": "full-time",
        "job_location": "New York",
        "job_salary": 50000,
        "currency": "USD",
        "job_experience": 3,
        "contact_person": "John Doe",
        "contact_email": "johndoe@example.com",
        "list_of_values": "hourly",
        "created_by": 1,
        "created_at": "2024-11-27T00:00:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-27T00:00:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "Validation failed.",
    "errors": {
        "job_title": [
            "The job title is required."
        ],
        "job_description": [
            "The job description is required."
        ]
    }
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/jobs/store

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

job_title   string   

The title of the job. Example: Software Engineer

job_description   string   

The description of the job. Example: A great job opportunity

job_type   string   

The type of the job (e.g., full-time, part-time). Example: full-time

job_location   string   

The location of the job. Example: New York

job_salary   numeric  optional  

optional The salary for the job. Example: 50000

list_of_values   string  optional  

optional List of additional job requirements or values. Example: hourly

currency   string  optional  

optional The currency for the salary. Example: USD

job_experience   numeric  optional  

optional The minimum experience required for the job. Example: 3

contact_person   string  optional  

optional The contact person for the job. Example: John Doe

contact_email   string  optional  

optional The contact email for the job. Example: johndoe@example.com

Update Job

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/jobs/edit/ad" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"job_title\": \"Software Engineer\",
    \"job_description\": \"A great job opportunity\",
    \"job_type\": \"full-time\",
    \"job_location\": \"New York\",
    \"job_salary\": \"50000\",
    \"list_of_values\": \"hourly\",
    \"currency\": \"USD\",
    \"job_experience\": \"3\",
    \"contact_person\": \"John Doe\",
    \"contact_email\": \"johndoe@example.com\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/jobs/edit/ad"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "job_title": "Software Engineer",
    "job_description": "A great job opportunity",
    "job_type": "full-time",
    "job_location": "New York",
    "job_salary": "50000",
    "list_of_values": "hourly",
    "currency": "USD",
    "job_experience": "3",
    "contact_person": "John Doe",
    "contact_email": "johndoe@example.com"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
  "message": "Job has been updated successfully.",
  "job": {
    "id": 1,
    "job_title": "Software Engineer",
    "job_description": "A great job opportunity",
    "job_type": "full-time",
    "job_location": "New York",
    "job_salary": 50000,
    "currency": "USD",
    "job_experience": 3,
    "contact_person": "John Doe",
    "contact_email": "johndoe@example.com",
    "list_of_values": "hourly"
    "created_by": 1,
    "created_at": "2024-11-27T00:00:00.000000Z",
    "updated_at": "2024-11-27T00:00:00.000000Z"
  }
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "Validation failed.",
    "errors": {
        "job_title": [
            "The job title is required."
        ],
        "job_description": [
            "The job description is required."
        ]
    }
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/jobs/edit/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   string   

The ID of the edit. Example: ad

Body Parameters

job_title   string   

The title of the job. Example: Software Engineer

job_description   string   

The description of the job. Example: A great job opportunity

job_type   string   

The type of the job (e.g., full-time, part-time). Example: full-time

job_location   string   

The location of the job. Example: New York

job_salary   numeric  optional  

optional The salary for the job. Example: 50000

list_of_values   string  optional  

optional List of additional job requirements or values. Example: hourly

currency   string  optional  

optional The currency for the salary. Example: USD

job_experience   numeric  optional  

optional The minimum experience required for the job. Example: 3

contact_person   string  optional  

optional The contact person for the job. Example: John Doe

contact_email   string  optional  

optional The contact email for the job. Example: johndoe@example.com

Delete Job

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/jobs/delete/alias" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/jobs/delete/alias"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Job has been deleted successfully."
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "Job not found."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

The ID of the delete. Example: alias

Search Job

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/jobs/search" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"query\": \"abc\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/jobs/search"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "query": "abc"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
  "data": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "job_title": "Software Developer",
      "job_description": "Full stack developer needed...",
      "job_type": "Full-time",
      "job_location": "New York",
      "job_salary": 100000,
      "currency": "USD",
      "job_experience": 3,
      "contact_person": "John Doe",
      "contact_email": "johndoe@example.com"
    },
    ...
  ]
}

Example response (201):


{
    "message": "An error occurred during the search"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

The title of the job. Example: abc

Meetings

List All Meetings

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/meetings/load?search=%22abc%22" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/meetings/load"
);

const params = {
    "search": ""abc"",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "user_id": 2,
            "title": "Project Sync",
            "description": "Weekly project sync meeting.",
            "start_time": "2024-11-10T09:00:00.000000Z",
            "end_time": "2024-11-10T10:00:00.000000Z",
            "meeting_link": "https://meeting.example.com/xyz123",
            "created_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
            "user": {
                "id": 2,
                "name": "John Doe",
                "email": "john@example.com"
            }
        }
    ]
}

Example response (201):


{
    "error": "Failed to load meetings."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/v3/user/meetings/load

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

search   string  optional  

optional for search. Example: "abc"

Create Meeting

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/meetings/store" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"title\": \"Project Sync\",
    \"description\": \"Weekly project sync meeting.\",
    \"start_time\": \"2024-11-22T01:25\",
    \"end_time\": \"2024-11-22T02:25\",
    \"meeting_link\": \"https:\\/\\/meeting.example.com\\/xyz123\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/meetings/store"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "title": "Project Sync",
    "description": "Weekly project sync meeting.",
    "start_time": "2024-11-22T01:25",
    "end_time": "2024-11-22T02:25",
    "meeting_link": "https:\/\/meeting.example.com\/xyz123"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Meeting created successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "user_id": 2,
        "title": "Project Sync",
        "description": "Weekly project sync meeting.",
        "start_time": "2024-11-22T01:25",
        "end_time": "2024-11-22T02:25",
        "meeting_link": "https://meeting.example.com/xyz123",
        "created_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (201):


{
    "error": "Failed to create meeting."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/meetings/store

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

title   string   

The title of the meeting. Example: Project Sync

description   string  optional  

The description of the meeting. Example: Weekly project sync meeting.

start_time   datetime   

The start time of the meeting in ISO 8601 format. Example: 2024-11-22T01:25

end_time   datetime   

The end time of the meeting in ISO 8601 format. Example: 2024-11-22T02:25

meeting_link   string  optional  

The link to join the meeting. Example: https://meeting.example.com/xyz123

Single Meeting Details

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/meetings/view/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/meetings/view/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "user_id": 2,
        "title": "Project Sync",
        "description": "Weekly project sync meeting.",
        "start_time": "2024-11-10T09:00:00.000000Z",
        "end_time": "2024-11-10T10:00:00.000000Z",
        "meeting_link": "https://meeting.example.com/xyz123",
        "created_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-11-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
        "user": {
            "id": 12,
            "ecclesia_id": 2,
            "created_id": "1",
            "user_name": "swarnadwip_nath",
            "first_name": "Swarnadwip",
            "middle_name": null,
            "last_name": "Nath",
            "email": "swarnadwip@excellisit.net",
            "phone": "+1 0741202022",
            "email_verified_at": null,
            "profile_picture": "profile_picture/yCvplMhdpjc0kIeKG63tfkZwhKNYbcF1ZhfQdDFO.jpg",
            "address": "Kokata",
            "city": "Kolkata",
            "state": "41",
            "address2": null,
            "country": "101",
            "zip": "700001",
            "status": 1,
            "created_at": "2024-06-21T11:31:27.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-09-09T11:02:59.000000Z"
        }
    }
}

    "error": "Meeting not found."
}

Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Update Meeting

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/meetings/edit/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"title\": \"Project Sync Update\",
    \"description\": \"Updated project sync meeting.\",
    \"start_time\": \"2024-11-11T09:00:00.000000Z\",
    \"end_time\": \"2024-11-11T10:00:00.000000Z\",
    \"meeting_link\": \"https:\\/\\/meeting.example.com\\/updated123\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/meetings/edit/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "title": "Project Sync Update",
    "description": "Updated project sync meeting.",
    "start_time": "2024-11-11T09:00:00.000000Z",
    "end_time": "2024-11-11T10:00:00.000000Z",
    "meeting_link": "https:\/\/meeting.example.com\/updated123"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Meeting updated successfully.",
    "status": true
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/meetings/edit/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the meeting. Example: 1

Body Parameters

title   string   

The title of the meeting. Example: Project Sync Update

description   string  optional  

The description of the meeting. Example: Updated project sync meeting.

start_time   datetime   

The updated start time in ISO 8601 format. Example: 2024-11-11T09:00:00.000000Z

end_time   datetime   

The updated end time in ISO 8601 format. Example: 2024-11-11T10:00:00.000000Z

meeting_link   string  optional  

The updated link for the meeting. Example: https://meeting.example.com/updated123

Members

List Of Members

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/partners/list?search=%22abc%22" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/partners/list"
);

const params = {
    "search": ""abc"",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

    --header "Accept: application/json"

    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/profile"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Update Profile

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/update-profile" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"first_name\": \"John\",
    \"middle_name\": \"Doe\",
    \"last_name\": \"Doe\",
    \"phone\": \"7415236986\",
    \"address\": \"51 DN Block Merlin Infinite Building, 9th Floor, Unit, 907, Sector V, Bidhannagar, Kolkata, West Bengal 700091\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/update-profile"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "first_name": "John",
    "middle_name": "Doe",
    "last_name": "Doe",
    "phone": "7415236986",
    "address": "51 DN Block Merlin Infinite Building, 9th Floor, Unit, 907, Sector V, Bidhannagar, Kolkata, West Bengal 700091"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Profile updated successfully"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/update-profile

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

first_name   string   

The first name of the user. Example: John

middle_name   string  optional  

optional The middle name of the user. Example: Doe

last_name   string   

The last name of the user. Example: Doe

phone   string   

The phone number of the user. Example: 7415236986

address   string   

The address of the user. Example: 51 DN Block Merlin Infinite Building, 9th Floor, Unit, 907, Sector V, Bidhannagar, Kolkata, West Bengal 700091

Update Profile Picture

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/profile-picture-update" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "profile_picture=@/private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpQysabR" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/profile-picture-update"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('profile_picture', document.querySelector('input[name="profile_picture"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Profile picture updated successfully"
}

Example response (201):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "The profile picture must be an image."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/profile-picture-update

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

profile_picture   file   

The profile picture of the user. Example: /private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpQysabR

Change Password

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/change-password" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"old_password\": \"password\",
    \"new_password\": \"password123\",
    \"confirm_password\": \"password123\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/change-password"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "old_password": "password",
    "new_password": "password123",
    "confirm_password": "password123"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Password changed successfully"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/change-password

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

old_password   string   

The old password of the user. Example: password

new_password   string   

The new password of the user. Example: password123

confirm_password   string   

The confirm password of the user. Example: password123

Check User Permission

requires authentication

Checks whether the authenticated user has a given permission.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/check-role-permission" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"permission_name\": \"Manage Email\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/check-role-permission"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "permission_name": "Manage Email"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "status": true,
    "message": "User has permission"
}

Example response (403):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "User does not have permission"
}

Example response (422):


{
    "message": "The permission_name field is required.",
    "status": false
}

Example response (500):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "An error occurred: [error_message]"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/check-role-permission

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

permission_name   string   

The name of the permission to check. Example: Manage Email

Check Menu Permissions

requires authentication

This endpoint checks the menu permissions for the authenticated user.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/check-menu-permission" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/check-menu-permission"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "status": true,
    "menus": [
        {
            "menu_name": "menu_a",
            "permission_name": "permission_name_aa",
            "active": true
        },
        {
            "menu_name": "menu_b",
            "permission_name": "permission_name_bb",
            "active": false
        },
        {
            "menu_name": "menu_c",
            "permission_name": "permission_name_cc",
            "active": true
        }
    ],
    "message": "Menu permissions fetched successfully"
}

Example response (201):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "An error occurred: <error_message>"
}

Example response (403):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "User does not have permission"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/check-menu-permission

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Notifications list

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/notifications" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/notifications"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "list": {
        "current_page": 1,
        "data": [
            {
                "id": 862,
                "user_id": 37,
                "chat_id": null,
                "message": "You have a <b>new mail</b> from masum@excellisit.net",
                "status": 0,
                "type": "Mail",
                "is_read": 0,
                "is_delete": 0,
                "created_at": "2024-12-04T05:40:32.000000Z",
                "updated_at": "2024-12-04T05:40:32.000000Z"
            },
            {
                "id": 860,
                "user_id": 37,
                "chat_id": null,
                "message": "You have a <b>new mail</b> from masum@excellisit.net",
                "status": 0,
                "type": "Mail",
                "is_read": 0,
                "is_delete": 0,
                "created_at": "2024-12-04T05:37:44.000000Z",
                "updated_at": "2024-12-04T05:37:44.000000Z"
            }
        ],
        "first_page_url": "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/notifications?page=1",
        "from": 1,
        "last_page": 15,
        "last_page_url": "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/notifications?page=15",

            {
                "url": null,
                "label": "&laquo; Previous",
                "active": false
            },
            {
                "url": "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/notifications?page=1",
                "label": "1",
                "active": true
            },
            {
                "url": "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/notifications?page=2",
                "label": "2",
                "active": false
            },
            {
                "url": "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/notifications?page=2",
                "label": "Next &raquo;",
                "active": false
            }
        ],
        "next_page_url": "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/notifications?page=2",

        "prev_page_url": null,
        "to": 15,
        "total": 216
    }

    "message": "Page not found"
}

Mark a notification as read.

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/notification-read/Chat/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/notification-read/Chat/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Notification marked as read"
}

Example response (404):


{
    "message": "Notification not found"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/v3/user/notification-read/{type}/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

type   string  optional  

The type of notification (Chat, Team, Mail). Example: Chat

id   integer  optional  

The ID of the notification. Example: 1

Delete all notifications

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/notification-clear" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/notification-clear"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "message": "Notification deleted successfully.",
    "status": true
}

Request failed with error:

If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.

Role Permission

All roles with permissions

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/roles/list" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/roles/list"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Request      

GET api/v3/user/roles/list

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Role permissions status

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/roles/edit/sed" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/roles/edit/sed"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Request      

POST api/v3/user/roles/edit/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   string   

The ID of the edit. Example: sed

Strategy

Strategies List

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/strategy/load?search=%22abc%22" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/strategy/load"
);

const params = {
    "search": ""abc"",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200):


{
    "data": {
        "current_page": 1,
        "data": [
            {
                "id": 7,

                "updated_at": "2024-11-11T07:02:33.000000Z"
            },

Request      

GET api/v3/user/strategy/load

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

search   string  optional  

optional for search. Example: "abc"

Create strategies

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/strategy/store" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "file=@/private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpCum0RL" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/strategy/store"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('file', document.querySelector('input[name="file"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200, success):


{
    "message": "Strategy(s) uploaded successfully."
}

Example response (201, error):


{
    "error": "Validation failed or duplicate strategy found."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/user/strategy/store

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

file   file   

files to upload. Example: /private/var/folders/wy/1yz2w5p91q13336262xr4yzw0000gn/T/phpCum0RL

Delete strategy

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/strategy/delete/9" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/strategy/delete/9"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200, success):


{
    "message": "Strategy deleted successfully."
}

Example response (201, error):


{
    "error": "Strategy not found or permission denied."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

);

    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

requires authentication

Example request:

    --get "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/strategy/view/14" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"

    "http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v3/user/strategy/view/14"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

Example response (200, success):


{
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "file_name": "strategy1.pdf",
        "file_extension": "pdf",
        "user_id": 1,
        "file": "strategies/strategy1.pdf"
    }
}

    "error": "Strategy not found or permission denied."
